author: Cortex XSOAR

automation.description: Transform a XSOAR indicator into a Crowd Strike Falcon IOC. The output (found at the TransformIndicatorToCSFalconIOC.JsonOutput context path) is a JSON, which represents the indicators in CS Falcon format. This JSON can be used as the input for the *cs-falcon-batch-upload-custom-ioc* command.
automation.name: TransformIndicatorToCSFalconIOC

automation.description: Load and return the processes file (generated from the cs-falcon-rtr-list-network-stats command) content.
automation.name: ReadNetstatFile

automation.description: Load and return the processes file (generated from the cs-falcon-rtr-list-processes command) content.
automation.name: ReadProcessesFile

classifier.description: CrowdStrike Falcon Mapper for incidents and detections
classifier.name: CrowdStrike Falcon Mapper

commands.description: Searches for a device that matches the query.
commands.name: cs-falcon-search-device

commands.description: Searches for and fetches the behavior that matches the query.
commands.name: cs-falcon-get-behavior

commands.description: Search for details of specific detections, either using a filter query, or by providing the IDs of the detections.
commands.name: cs-falcon-search-detection

commands.description: Resolves and updates a detection using the provided arguments. At least one optional argument must be passed, otherwise no change will take place.
commands.name: cs-falcon-resolve-detection

commands.description: Contains containment for a specified host. When contained, a host can only communicate with the CrowdStrike cloud and any IPs specified in your containment policy.
commands.name: cs-falcon-contain-host

commands.description: Lifts containment on the host, which returns its network communications to normal.
commands.name: cs-falcon-lift-host-containment

commands.description: Sends commands to hosts.
commands.name: cs-falcon-run-command

commands.description: Uploads a script to Falcon.
commands.name: cs-falcon-upload-script

commands.description: Uploads a file to the CrowdStrike cloud. (Can be used for the RTR 'put' command.)
commands.name: cs-falcon-upload-file

commands.description: Deletes a file based on the provided ID. Can delete only one file at a time.
commands.name: cs-falcon-delete-file

commands.description: Returns files based on the provided IDs. These files are used for the RTR 'put' command.
commands.name: cs-falcon-get-file

commands.description: Returns a list of put-file IDs that are available for the user in the 'put' command.
commands.name: cs-falcon-list-files

commands.description: Returns custom scripts based on the provided ID. Used for the RTR 'runscript' command.
commands.name: cs-falcon-get-script

commands.description: Deletes a custom-script based on the provided ID. Can delete only one script at a time.
commands.name: cs-falcon-delete-script

commands.description: Returns a list of custom script IDs that are available for the user in the 'runscript' command.
commands.name: cs-falcon-list-scripts

commands.description: Runs a script on the agent host.
commands.name: cs-falcon-run-script

commands.description: Batch executes 'get' command across hosts to retrieve files.
commands.name: cs-falcon-run-get-command

commands.description: Retrieves the status of the specified batch 'get' command.
commands.name: cs-falcon-status-get-command

commands.description: Gets the status of a command executed on a host.
commands.name: cs-falcon-status-command

commands.description: Gets the RTR extracted file contents for the specified session and SHA256 hash.
commands.name: cs-falcon-get-extracted-file

commands.description: Gets a list of files for the specified RTR session on a host.
commands.name: cs-falcon-list-host-files

commands.description: Refresh a session timeout on a single host.
commands.name: cs-falcon-refresh-session

commands.description: Deprecated. Use the cs-falcon-search-custom-iocs command instead.
commands.name: cs-falcon-search-iocs

commands.description: Deprecated. Use the cs-falcon-get-custom-ioc command instead.
commands.name: cs-falcon-get-ioc

commands.description: Deprecated. Use the cs-falcon-upload-custom-ioc command instead.
commands.name: cs-falcon-upload-ioc

commands.description: Deprecated. Use the cs-falcon-update-custom-ioc command instead.
commands.name: cs-falcon-update-ioc

commands.description: Deprecated. Use the cs-falcon-delete-custom-ioc command instead.
commands.name: cs-falcon-delete-ioc

commands.description: Returns a list of your uploaded IOCs that match the search criteria.
commands.name: cs-falcon-search-custom-iocs

commands.description: Gets the full definition of one or more indicators that you are watching.
commands.name: cs-falcon-get-custom-ioc

commands.description: Uploads an indicator for CrowdStrike to monitor.
commands.name: cs-falcon-upload-custom-ioc

commands.description: Updates an indicator for CrowdStrike to monitor.
commands.name: cs-falcon-update-custom-ioc

commands.description: Deletes a monitored indicator.
commands.name: cs-falcon-delete-custom-ioc

commands.description: The number of hosts that observed the provided IOC.
commands.name: cs-falcon-device-count-ioc

commands.description: Get processes associated with a given IOC.
commands.name: cs-falcon-processes-ran-on

commands.description: Retrieves the details of a process, according to the process ID, that is running or that previously ran.
commands.name: cs-falcon-process-details

commands.description: Returns a list of device IDs on which an indicator ran.
commands.name: cs-device-ran-on

commands.description: Returns a list of device IDs on which an indicator ran.
commands.name: cs-falcon-device-ran-on

commands.description: Lists detection summaries.
commands.name: cs-falcon-list-detection-summaries

commands.description: Lists incident summaries.
commands.name: cs-falcon-list-incident-summaries

commands.description: Returns information about an endpoint.
commands.name: endpoint

commands.description: Create a host group.
commands.name: cs-falcon-create-host-group

commands.description: List the available host groups.
commands.name: cs-falcon-list-host-groups

commands.description: Delete the requested host groups.
commands.name: cs-falcon-delete-host-groups

commands.description: Update a host group.
commands.name: cs-falcon-update-host-group

commands.description: Get the list of host group members.
commands.name: cs-falcon-list-host-group-members

commands.description: Add host group members.
commands.name: cs-falcon-add-host-group-members

commands.description: Remove host group members.
commands.name: cs-falcon-remove-host-group-members

commands.description: Resolve incidents.
commands.name: cs-falcon-resolve-incident

commands.description: Uploads a batch of indicators.
commands.name: cs-falcon-batch-upload-custom-ioc

commands.description: Execute an active responder kill command on a single host.
commands.name: cs-falcon-rtr-kill-process

commands.description: Batch executes an RTR active-responder remove file across the hosts mapped to the given batch ID.
commands.name: cs-falcon-rtr-remove-file

commands.description: Executes an RTR active-responder ps command to get a list of active processes across the given host.
commands.name: cs-falcon-rtr-list-processes

commands.description: Executes an RTR active-responder netstat command to get a list of network status and protocol statistics across the given host.
commands.name: cs-falcon-rtr-list-network-stats

commands.description: Executes an RTR active-responder read registry keys command across the given hosts. This command is valid only for Windows hosts.
commands.name: cs-falcon-rtr-read-registry

commands.description: Executes an RTR active-responder netstat command to get a list of scheduled tasks across the given host. This command is valid only for Windows hosts.
commands.name: cs-falcon-rtr-list-scheduled-tasks

commands.description: Gets the RTR extracted file contents for the specified file path.
commands.name: cs-falcon-rtr-retrieve-file

commands.description: Gets the detections for a specific incident.
commands.name: cs-falcon-get-detections-for-incident

commands.description: Returns the list of fields to map in outgoing mirroring. This command is only used for debugging purposes.
commands.name: get-mapping-fields

commands.description: Get remote data from a remote incident or detection. This method does not update the current incident or detection, and should be used for debugging purposes only.
commands.name: get-remote-data

commands.description: Get the list of incidents and detections that were modified since the last update time. This method is used for debugging purposes. The get-modified-remote-data command is used as part of the Mirroring feature that was introduced in Cortex XSOAR version 6.1.
commands.name: get-modified-remote-data

commands.description: Updates the remote incident or detection with local incident or detection changes. This method is only used for debugging purposes and will not update the current incident or detection.
commands.name: update-remote-system

integration.description: The CrowdStrike Falcon OAuth 2 API (formerly the Falcon Firehose API), enables fetching and resolving detections, searching devices, getting behaviors by ID, containing hosts, and lifting host containment.
integration.name: CrowdStrike Falcon

playbook.description: This playbook unisolates devices according to the device ID that is provided in the playbook input.
playbook.name: Crowdstrike Falcon - Unisolate Endpoint

playbook.description: This playbook will auto isolate endpoints by the device ID that was provided in the playbook.
playbook.name: Crowdstrike Falcon - Isolate Endpoint

description: The CrowdStrike Falcon OAuth 2 API (formerly the Falcon Firehose API), enables fetching and resolving detections, searching devices, getting behaviors by ID, containing hosts, and lifting host containment.
name: CrowdStrike Falcon
